com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.application

Class DirectedTopology

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.application.DirectedTopology
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IApplicationTopology

    public class DirectedTopology
extends java.lang.Object
implements IApplicationTopology
    Enables a directed (or hierarchical) logical topology. The graph/topology may have loops. The following topological relationships are supported:
    • TopologyRelationship.Reachable - a path, regardless of edge direction, exists between two nodes. // TODO: should we use edge direction?
    • TopologyRelationship.Neighbor - a single hop path, regardless of edge direction, exists between two nodes. // TODO: should we use edge direction?
    • TopologyRelationship.Child - represents a destination node
    • TopologyRelationship.Parent - represents a source node
    Author:
    dawood

      • isReachable

        protected static boolean isReachable(IPhysicalTopology physTopo,
                  IApplicationDescriptor... appDesc)
        See if the given nodes are all reachable as determined by the given physical topology.
        Parameters:
        physTopo -
        appDesc - a list of descriptors, all using the same name space.
        Returns:
        true if all given descriptors are reachable.

      • getRelationships

        public java.util.Collection<TopologyRelationship> getRelationships(IApplicationDescriptor wrt,
                                                          IApplicationDescriptor to,
                                                          IPhysicalTopology physTopo)
        Returns a list containing one or more of
        • TopologyRelationship.Reachable
        • TopologyRelationship.Neighbor
        • TopologyRelationship.Child
        • TopologyRelationship.Parent
        Specified by:
        getRelationships in interface IApplicationTopology
        Parameters:
        wrt - the application peer for which the relationship(s) to the to node are desired. If wrt is a child of to then TopologicalRelationship.Child is returned in the list.
        to - the application peer for which its relationship with from is desired. If to is a child of wrt then TopologicalRelationship.Parent is returned in the list.
        Returns:
        never null.
        See Also:
        IApplicationTopology.getRelationships(com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.IApplicationDescriptor, com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.IApplicationDescriptor, com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.IPhysicalTopology)
